parallel

Class MsgPassingCoordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator

  • public class MsgPassingCoordinator
extends java.lang.Object
    The MsgPassingCoordinator class is yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads. Threads can call the method sendData(thread-id, data) to asynchronously store some data in a queue that only the thread with thread-id can retrieve (in a FIFO fashion only). The data Objects that are stored are not copies of the original objects, but rather references to them and so should not be changed in any way after they are stored via a call to sendData... or more appropriately, the sender thread should make sure it sends to the receiver thread a copy of the data it intends to send. Unfortunately, the latter strategy cannot be effectively enforced as Object.clone() is a protected method, and it cannot be called on the parameter passed in the send method from this code. Also, if we require that the objects to be sent implement some interface (say, Clonable, as opposed to the Java built-in (empty) Cloneable interface), then the objects that we are most likely interested in sending/receiving, which are Java built-in data types including arrays, will not be passable per se... Notice that the ids used in the method signatures do not have to be actually tied to some kind of "thread-id" associated with the calling threads, but are instead simple designations for who can read a datum and who can send a datum to where.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Field Detail

      • _maxSize

        private static int _maxSize
        the maximum size of the queue that holds messages for this coordinator. Can be set only prior to any normal use by a call to the static method setMaxSize(num). Default is 10000.

      • setMaxSize

        public static void setMaxSize(int num)
                       throws ParallelException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sets the size of the queue of messages. Must be called only prior to any other call to the getInstance() methods.
        Parameters:
        num - int the new maximum size of the queue.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if a call to the getInstance() methods occurred before this call.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0.

      • getNumTasksInQueue

        public int getNumTasksInQueue()
        get the current number of tasks in the queue awaiting processing.
        Returns:
        int

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
                     java.lang.Object data)
              throws ParallelException
        stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        myid - int the id of the thread calling this method
        data - Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there are more data than _maxSize in the queue

      • sendDataBlocking

        public void sendDataBlocking(int myid,
                             java.lang.Object data)
        stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method will wait if the queue is full until another thread consumes a datum and allows this thread to write to the _data buffer.
        Parameters:
        myid - int the id of the thread calling this method
        data - Object

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
                     int threadId,
                     java.lang.Object data)
              throws ParallelException
        stores the data object to be consumed only by the first thread that invokes the method recvData(threadId)- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        myid - int my thread's id
        threadId - int the id of the thread that is the recipient
        data - Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there are more data than _maxSize in the queue or if the thread tries to send smth to itself

      • sendDataBlocking

        public void sendDataBlocking(int myid,
                             int threadId,
                             java.lang.Object data)
                      throws ParallelException
        stores the data object to be consumed only by the first thread that invokes the method recvData(threadId)- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method will wait if the queue is full until another thread consumes a datum and allows this thread to write to the _data buffer.
        Parameters:
        threadId - int
        data - Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the thread tries to send data to itself

      • recvData

        public java.lang.Object recvData(int myid)
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call (from another thread) to sendData(data) or sendData(threadId, data). If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until another thread stores an appropriate datum. This implementation will invoke wait() if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread, and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        Returns:
        Object

      • recvDataIfAnyExist

        public java.lang.Object recvDataIfAnyExist(int myid)
        the method has the same semantics as the recvData(tid) method except that it returns immediately with null if no appropriate data exist at the time of the call. There is one exception: this implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread (without checking if any data exist or not), and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int the threadId
        Returns:
        Object

      • recvData

        public java.lang.Object recvData(int myid,
                                 int fromid)
                          throws ParallelException
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call to sendData(fromid, data) or sendData(fromid, threadId, data). In other words, we wait for a msg from a particular thread. If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until the right thread stores an appropriate datum. This implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread, and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromid - int the sender's id
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==fromid

      • recvDataIgnoringFromIdOnNegativeMyId

        public java.lang.Object recvDataIgnoringFromIdOnNegativeMyId(int myid,
                                                             int fromid)
                                                      throws ParallelException
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call to sendData(fromid, data) or sendData(fromid, threadId, data), unless the sender specified as their id a negative number, in which case the threadId value is ignored. In other words, we wait for a msg from a particular thread (fromid) unless myid is negative, and also the sender of the object sent this negative number. This feature is only used to implement the parallel.distributed.PDBatchTaskExecutor. runTaskOnAllThreads(TaskObject task) method that requires guarantee that a task will be executed on all threads in the executor's thread-pool. If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until the right thread stores an appropriate datum. This implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread, and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromid - int the sender's id
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==fromid

      • recvDataIfAnyExist

        public java.lang.Object recvDataIfAnyExist(int myid,
                                           int fromid)
                                    throws ParallelException
        the method has the same semantics as the recvData(tid) method except that it returns immediately with null if no appropriate data exist at the time of the call. There is one exception: this implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread (without checking if any data exist or not), and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromid - int the msg must be from this sender
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==fromid

      • selRecvData

        public PairObjDouble selRecvData(int myid,
                                 java.util.List fromids)
                          throws ParallelException,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        perform an essentially selective-receive (interruptible) blocking operation.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromids - List // List<Integer>
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble a Pair object whose "object" part is the received data and the "Double" part is the integer id of the fromids list on which the data was received.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the first arg is contained in the second arg.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted by some other thread calling interrupt() on the thread executing the selRecvData() while it's on wait-mode.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fromids is null or empty
